main_question: How can a party in power be defeated in Parliament?
question: How can a party in power be defeated in Parliament?
possible_answers: A. If there is a revolution
B. If the King orders the party to resign
C. If a majority of the MPs vote against a major government decision
D. If a minority of the MPs vote against a major government decision
answer: C. If a majority of the MPs vote against a major government decision
explanatory_sentence: If a majority of the members of the House of Commons vote against a major government decision (a matter of confidence), the party in power is defeated and the Prime Minister usually asks the Governor General to call an election.
